column3: More flexibility in the code for when MAX_BLOCK_SIZE is no longer a constant.\n

Perhaps my question wasn't clear -- why limit the number of transactions at all? We should probably do overflow checks (which would mean a real limit of 4 billion transactions), but I'm not sure why this would ever be a purposefully, further constrained parameter.\n

I guess another option would be to just replace `MAX_BLOCK_SIZE / 60` with a static constant in merkleblock.cpp.\nWhat you are saying is that changing that constant to a huge value wouldn't be a hardfork and it's therefore easier to just decouple merkleblock.cpp from MAX_BLOCK_SIZE, correct? \n

That check is really just a sanity check, and IMHO shouldn't be there as Merkle trees are used for other purposes. There is no reason to explicitly limit the number of transactions, and a generic merkle tree validator shouldn't have such a limitation built into it.\n
Ok, so you suggest to just remove the check then?\n
